description: Sanji jumps over his opponent and drops downward while spinning like a drill, striking with his extended leg aimed directly at the target. The spinning motion and downward force creates devastating impact.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Defeats Jerry with Brochette
keyMoments.description: Sanji uses Brochette for the first time, effortlessly defeating CP6 agent Jerry in a single strike.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the technique's power and Sanji's combat superiority over government agents.

namingOrigin: French for 'skewer,' fitting Sanji's cooking-themed attack naming convention
visualDescription: Sanji performs an aerial spinning motion resembling a drill or skewer, with his leg extended to maximize impact upon landing on the opponent.
weaknesses: Requires aerial positioning and space to execute properly
trivia: The technique's name and motion parallel the cooking action of skewering meat on a brochette.

description: Rapid-fire boxing punches delivered at extreme speed, creating the visual illusion that Jerry has multiple arms attacking simultaneously. The technique is named after the aurora borealis phenomenon, suggesting the multi-armed visual effect.

keyMoments.title: Jerry Unleashes Aurora Flicker Jab Against Sanji
keyMoments.description: Jerry demonstrates his signature rapid-punch technique against Sanji, though it proves ineffective against the Straw Hat cook.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jerry's fighting capabilities and boxing expertise, drawing parallels to Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Gatling.

namingOrigin: Named after the aurora (northern lights) due to the multiple-armed visual effect, combined with 'flicker jab,' a boxing term for rapid straight punches
visualDescription: Extremely rapid straight punches that create afterimages, making it appear as though Jerry has numerous arms all punching simultaneously.
weaknesses: Ineffective against opponents with superior speed or defensive capabilities
trivia: The technique's visual similarity to Luffy's Gatling Gun was intentional, showcasing how different fighting styles can produce similar attack patterns.

description: Boxing combination punches (one-two combo) delivered while Jerry is in a compressed yoga position with his legs positioned behind his head. This unique adaptation allows him to fight effectively in confined spaces despite his extreme height.

keyMoments.title: Jerry Demonstrates Yoga Fighting Adaptation
keyMoments.description: Jerry reveals his yoga-based fighting stance, showcasing his ability to compress his 22-foot-tall frame for combat in the confined train car.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates creative combat adaptation and Jerry's training for various scenarios.

namingOrigin: Combines 'Yoga' (the flexibility practice) with 'One Two' (a basic boxing combination)
visualDescription: Jerry contorts his extremely tall body using yoga positioning, placing his legs behind his head while throwing traditional boxing punches.
weaknesses: Compromised mobility and balance while in yoga position
trivia: Jerry's yoga training was specifically for fighting in confined spaces, showing the specialized preparation of World Government agents.

description: A spinning kick attack where Jerry rotates his body like a screw while delivering a drop kick to his opponent.
namingOrigin: Named for the screwing/spinning motion combined with a drop kick
visualDescription: A rotating aerial kick attack with spinning momentum.
weaknesses: Unknown - technique mentioned but not shown in detail during the episode
trivia: This technique was mentioned as part of Jerry's repertoire but not prominently featured in his brief battle with Sanji.
